sentences.en: Burton’s enemies had made false accusations against him.
sentences.cn: 伯顿的敌人对他提出不实的指责。

sentences.en: Can you show good cause for your accusation?
Clarke swung at his shadow the accusation that he was "a tabloid politician".
sentences.cn: 克拉克指责影子内阁中的对手是个“八卦政客”.

sentences.en: He filed an accusation with the police.
I don't want to make an accusation until I have some proof.
sentences.cn: 我要有一些证据以后才提出控告。

sentences.en: I was furious at his making such an accusation.
sentences.cn: 我对他的这种责备非常气愤.

sentences.en: It was frivolous of him to make such an accusation.
sentences.cn: 他提出这样的指控真无聊.
她完全否认被控的罪名.

sentences.en: She denied the accusation with some warmth, ie strenuously , forcefully.
sentences.cn: 她有些激动, 竭力否认这一指责.

sentences.en: She knew that no one would believe her accusation.
sentences.cn: 她知道没人会相信她的指控.

sentences.en: She maintains that the accusation is groundless.
sentences.cn: 她坚持该指控是毫无根据的.

sentences.en: She’s made all sorts of wild accusations against me in the past.
sentences.cn: 她过去对我妄加指责，说了种种不是。

sentences.en: The main accusation levelled against him was that he tried to avoid military service.
sentences.cn: 对他提出的主要指控是他想逃避兵役。

sentences.en: Their groundless accusation is made with ulterior motives.
sentences.cn: 他们的无端攻击是别有用心的.

sentences.en: There was a hint of accusation in her voice.
sentences.cn: 她的话音中暗含指责的意思.

sentences.en: They fled the country, amid accusations of corruption.
sentences.cn: 在一片贪污腐败的指责声中，他们逃离了该国。

sentences.en: They leveled an accusation against her.
This sounds like a barrage of accusation—I don'tintend it to be.
sentences.cn: 这听起来像是接二连三的指责——这并非我的本意。

sentences.en: Your accusation must be grounded on facts.
sentences.cn: 你的指责必须以事实为依据.

words.tran_cn: 非难的，指责的；控诉的，控告的

trans.tran_cn: 指责，控告，（尚未证实的被控告的）罪名
trans.tran_en: a statement saying that someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something wrong
